Crimes.Crime_Name: Offence under subsection 238(1) of the Income Tax Act
Crimes.Dispute_Type: Dispute over whether the respondent complied with a legal requirement for information/documents
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether SML Operations (Canada) Ltd. failed to comply with a requirement under subsection 231.2(1) of the Income Tax Act, making it liable for penalties under subsection 238(1)
Crimes.Procedural_Stage: Minister applied for an order under subsection 231.7(1)
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Partial compliance occurred; no clear evidence of intentional non-cooperation; privilege status of documents undetermined
Crimes.Credibility_Factor: Ambiguity in addressing the requirement to the corporation or individual
Crimes.Legal_Rule: Subsection 231.2(1) allows the Minister to require any person to provide information/documents; subsection 238(1) imposes penalties for non-compliance
Crimes.Standard_of_Review: Conditions for ordering compliance under subsection 231.7(1)
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged failure to comply with information/document request
Crimes.Outcome_on_Merits: Claim dismissed due to lack of proof that requirement was directed at respondent
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Unclear direction of requirement affects fairness
Crimes.Key_Evidence_Considered: Nature of the requirement, partial compliance by Mr. Wainio
Crimes.Legal_Framework: Sections 231.2(1), 231.7(1), and 238(1) of the Income Tax Act
Crimes.Applicant_Challenge: Ministerâ€™s inability to prove requirement was directed at the corporation
Crimes.Court_Result: Respondent not ordered to produce documents
Crimes.Defendant_Response: Partial compliance; challenge to jurisdiction and clarity of requirement
Crimes.Applicable_Process: Application for court order under tax administration provisions
Crimes.Jurisdiction: Federal (Tax Court or equivalent under Income Tax Act)

Crimes.Crime_Name: Failure to comply with subsection 231.2(1) of the Income Tax Act
Crimes.Dispute_Type: Dispute over whether the requirement was directed to the corporation or an individual
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether SML Operations (Canada) Ltd. failed to provide information/documents as required under subsection 231.2(1)
Crimes.Procedural_Stage: Minister sought a court order under subsection 231.7(1) after alleged non-compliance
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Ambiguity in addressing the requirement; partial compliance by Mr. Wainio
Crimes.Credibility_Factor: Uncertainty regarding addressee of the legal requirement
Crimes.Legal_Rule: Subsection 231.2(1) authorizes the Minister to require information/documents from any person for tax administration purposes
Crimes.Standard_of_Review: Requirements for court enforcement under subsection 231.7(1)
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Ambiguity in the recipient of the requirement
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged non-compliance with a statutory information requirement
Crimes.Outcome_on_Merits: Claim dismissed due to uncertainty in addressing and lack of clear non-compliance
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Requirement must be clearly directed to the party sought to be compelled
Crimes.Key_Evidence_Considered: Text and delivery of the requirement, actions of Mr. Wainio
Crimes.Legal_Framework: Sections 231.2(1) and 231.7(1) of the Income Tax Act
Crimes.Applicant_Challenge: Failure to establish that the requirement was properly served on the corporation
Crimes.Defendant_Response: Contested applicability of requirement due to misdirection
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Requirement not clearly directed to the corporate respondent
